title: Drawing, "Design for the Entrance Hall, the East Wall, the Royal Pavilion, Brighton", 1802
medium:
Watercolor, pen and black ink, traces of graphite (?)
Support: paper
markings: Wove paper, no watermark visible; compass punctures
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Horizontal rectangle.  Elevation of a wall, with a painted design in imitation of stone-work.  Niches to left and right contain console tables bearing seated figures of deities.  Before the central section is placed a tall urn-shaped stove.  The upper section of the wall contains a painted decoration within a marbleized border.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for the Entrance Hall, the East Wall, the Royal Pavilion, Brighton", 1802.

Support: paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-34.
